title: Bank of Japan keeps benchmark interest rate steady as it treads cautiously on normalizing policy
content: The decision came as the central bank seeks to wean its economy off the long-held ultra-easy monetary policy and curb the yen's slide against the U.S. dollar.
summary: The decision came as the central bank seeks to wean its economy off the long-held ultra-easy monetary policy and curb the yen's slide against the U.S. dollar.

title: China unexpectedly leaves benchmark lending rates unchanged after Fed's jumbo cut
content: The People's Bank of China (PBOC) said it would keep the one-year loan prime rate (LPR) at 3.35%, as well as the five-year LPR at 3.85%.
summary: The People's Bank of China (PBOC) said it would keep the one-year loan prime rate (LPR) at 3.35%, as well as the five-year LPR at 3.85%.

title: The Fed has set out on a 'recalibration' of policy. Here's what Powell's new buzzword means
content: Asset prices soared as investors took Powell at his word that the outsized rate cut wasn't in response to a substantial economic weakening.
summary: Asset prices soared as investors took Powell at his word that the outsized rate cut wasn't in response to a substantial economic weakening.

title: Japan's Nikkei leads gains in Asia after Wall Street soars; BOJ and PBOC keep rates unchanged
content: Traders in Asia will also look toward August consumer prices index from Japan and Hong Kong, and central bank decisions from Bank of Japan and People's Bank of China.
summary: Traders in Asia will also look toward August consumer prices index from Japan and Hong Kong, and central bank decisions from Bank of Japan and People's Bank of China.

title: Nike CEO John Donahoe is out, replaced by company veteran Elliott Hill
content: Nike CEO John Donahoe will retire from the company in October. He will be replaced by company veteran Elliott Hill.
summary: Nike CEO John Donahoe will retire from the company in October. He will be replaced by company veteran Elliott Hill.

title: CNBC Daily Open: One day makes all the difference
content: “Twenty-four little hours / Brought the sun and the flowers / Where there used to be rain,” sings Dinah Washington. She could've been singing about markets.
summary: “Twenty-four little hours / Brought the sun and the flowers / Where there used to be rain,” sings Dinah Washington. She could've been singing about markets.

title: 'Very serious escalation': Lebanese ministers warn of a dangerous next 48 hours after pager and device attacks
content: The next 48 hours, Lebanon's health and economy ministers told CNBC, will be particularly dangerous.
summary: The next 48 hours, Lebanon's health and economy ministers told CNBC, will be particularly dangerous.

title: Ray Dalio says the Fed has a tough balancing act as the economy faces 'enormous amount of debt'
content: On Wednesday, Dalio listed debt, money and the economic cycle as one of the top five forces influencing the global economy.
summary: On Wednesday, Dalio listed debt, money and the economic cycle as one of the top five forces influencing the global economy.

title: Tesla’s Chinese rival Nio cuts price for new Onvo-branded car
content: There's yet another Chinese electric car aiming to undercut Tesla, with a steeper discount.
summary: There's yet another Chinese electric car aiming to undercut Tesla, with a steeper discount.

title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: Will India's lofty manufacturing ambitions bear fruit?
content: As the 10th anniversary of the Make in India initiative nears, CNBC's Inside India takes a look at how the nation's manufacturing has evolved — and what more needs to be done.
summary: As the 10th anniversary of the Make in India initiative nears, CNBC's Inside India takes a look at how the nation's manufacturing has evolved — and what more needs to be done.

title: Tesla, Nvidia lead tech-heavy Nasdaq to one of best days of 2024 after Fed rate cut
content: Following the Federal Reserve's interest rate cut, tech stocks had a slightly delayed rally but jumped on Thursday, with the Nasdaq climbing 2.5%.
summary: Following the Federal Reserve's interest rate cut, tech stocks had a slightly delayed rally but jumped on Thursday, with the Nasdaq climbing 2.5%.

title: Elon Musk's X and Starlink face nearly $1 million in daily fines for alleged ban evasion in Brazil
content: X and Starlink face daily fines of $5 million reals (about $920,000) for alleged ban evasion maneuvers by X in Brazil.
summary: X and Starlink face daily fines of $5 million reals (about $920,000) for alleged ban evasion maneuvers by X in Brazil.

title: Disney to ditch Slack following July data breach
content: The company's Slack server was hacked in July, leading to more than a terabyte of company data being leaked to the public.
summary: The company's Slack server was hacked in July, leading to more than a terabyte of company data being leaked to the public.

title: Bank of England presses pause on rate cuts, highlights 'gradual approach'
content: The decision to hold comes after the U.S. Federal Reserve kicked off its own monetary easing with an aggressive 50 basis point rate cut.
summary: The decision to hold comes after the U.S. Federal Reserve kicked off its own monetary easing with an aggressive 50 basis point rate cut.

title: Trump Media hits new post-merger low as DJT sale restrictions set to lift
content: Donald Trump, the majority shareholder of Trump Media and the biggest name on Truth Social, said he has no plans to sell his DJT stock when the lockup ends.
summary: Donald Trump, the majority shareholder of Trump Media and the biggest name on Truth Social, said he has no plans to sell his DJT stock when the lockup ends.

title: Japan faces labor shortages and demographic crisis as elderly population hits record high
content: Japan's number of people aged 65 and over has reached a record high, cementing it as the worlds most elderly country, according to government statistics.
summary: Japan's number of people aged 65 and over has reached a record high, cementing it as the worlds most elderly country, according to government statistics.

title: Amazon introduces Amelia, an AI assistant for third-party sellers
content: Amelia is the latest generative AI product from Amazon, which is using the technology across its retail portfolio.
summary: Amelia is the latest generative AI product from Amazon, which is using the technology across its retail portfolio.

title: Largest port on U.S. East Coast, New York/New Jersey, begins prepping for what could be first union strike since 1977
content: A deadline of Oct. 1 for a new deal between port workers and ownership is approaching, and after talks broke down during the summer, tensions are high.
summary: A deadline of Oct. 1 for a new deal between port workers and ownership is approaching, and after talks broke down during the summer, tensions are high.

title: European markets close higher after Bank of England holds rates, Fed cuts
content: European markets closed higher Thursday as investors digested the latest monetary policy decisions from the U.S. Federal Reserve and the Bank of England.
summary: European markets closed higher Thursday as investors digested the latest monetary policy decisions from the U.S. Federal Reserve and the Bank of England.

title: What buying Commerzbank would mean for UniCredit — and the banking sector
content: Analysts have welcomed the move by UniCredit, particularly because a tie-up between the two banks might spur more M&A activity in Europe's banking sector.
summary: Analysts have welcomed the move by UniCredit, particularly because a tie-up between the two banks might spur more M&A activity in Europe's banking sector.

title: How Fed rate cuts affect the global economy
content: Federal Reserve interest rate decisions can influence the trajectory of the U.S. economy and create spillover effects in parts of the global financial system.
summary: Federal Reserve interest rate decisions can influence the trajectory of the U.S. economy and create spillover effects in parts of the global financial system.

title: China's Alibaba launches over 100 new open-source AI models, releases text-to-video generation tool
content: Alibaba is hoping its latest AI offerings may tempt customers around the world to sign up to its cloud services.
summary: Alibaba is hoping its latest AI offerings may tempt customers around the world to sign up to its cloud services.

title: Billionaire tech CEO says bosses shouldn't 'BS' employees about the impact AI will have on jobs
content: Business leaders shouldn't "BS" employees about the impact of AI on jobs, according to one tech billionaire, who says they should be transparent and honest.
summary: Business leaders shouldn't "BS" employees about the impact of AI on jobs, according to one tech billionaire, who says they should be transparent and honest.

title: Federal judge extends block on Biden’s student debt forgiveness plan
content: U.S. District Judge Randal Hall extended a restraining order against the Biden administration's latest student debt forgiveness plan.
summary: U.S. District Judge Randal Hall extended a restraining order against the Biden administration's latest student debt forgiveness plan.

title: China would love a domestic Nvidia rival — but that's proving quite the challenge
content: Chinese firms face a number of challenges in trying to rival Nvidia including contending with U.S. export restrictions and a lack of tech expertise.
summary: Chinese firms face a number of challenges in trying to rival Nvidia including contending with U.S. export restrictions and a lack of tech expertise.

title: Ray Dalio calls upcoming U.S. election the most consequential of his lifetime
content: Speaking to CNBC's "Squawk Box Asia" on Thursday, the founder of Bridgewater Associates explained that what the U.S. needs is "broad-based prosperity."
summary: Speaking to CNBC's "Squawk Box Asia" on Thursday, the founder of Bridgewater Associates explained that what the U.S. needs is "broad-based prosperity."

title: Binance CEO says crypto exchange saw 40% growth this year in institutional, corporate investors
content: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance has seen a 40% increase this year in institutional and corporate investors, CEO Richard Teng told CNBC's Lin Lin.
summary: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance has seen a 40% increase this year in institutional and corporate investors, CEO Richard Teng told CNBC's Lin Lin.

title: Here's what changed in the new Fed statement
content: Here's how the central bank's policy statement changed for its September rate decision.

title: Boeing starts furloughing tens of thousands of employees amid machinist strike
content: CEO Kelly Ortberg said affected employees would take one week of furlough every four weeks for the strike's duration and he and his team would take pay cuts.
summary: CEO Kelly Ortberg said affected employees would take one week of furlough every four weeks for the strike's duration and he and his team would take pay cuts.

title: Taiwan manufacturer rejects links to Lebanon's exploding pager attacks, names Hungarian firm
content: The company said that the design and manufacturing of the pagers were handled by a Hungary-based company called BAC.
summary: The company said that the design and manufacturing of the pagers were handled by a Hungary-based company called BAC.
